summary: This bill, the Taiwan Travel and Tourism Coordination Act, aims to improve cooperation between the United States and Taiwan on travel and tourism. It mandates the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Travel and Tourism, in coordination with the Secretaries of Commerce and State, to engage with Taiwanese authorities to enhance travel and strengthen tourism industries. The bill outlines specific cooperation efforts, including facilitating industry partnerships, advising on cultural heritage preservation, coordinating on visitor safety, and conducting mutually beneficial activities. It also requires reports to Congress on implementation and feasibility of establishing a preclearance facility in Taiwan.
